Definition: The input contains an argument and a keypoint on the topic "We should prohibit women in combat", separated by "<sep>".Your task is to answer if the keypoint matches the argument and summarizes exactly what the argument means, in the context of this topic.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: There is no reason that a women that meets the standards should not be put in combat if she chooses to do so<sep>Keypoint: Women should be accepted as long as they pass the tests
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that there is no reason that a women that meets the standards should not be put in combat if she chooses to do so

Positive Examples.input: Argument: Women are a distraction in combat and are too emotional for the realities of warfare.<sep>Keypoint: Women cannot overcome physical/emotional/mental barriers
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that women are a distraction in combat and are too emotional for the realities of warfare.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: Women should be allowed in combat because they can possess the same skills as men to be able to perform effectively.<sep>Keypoint: Women are an asset in combat
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that women should be allowed in combat because they can possess the same skills as men to be able to perform effectively.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Women are just as capable at defending our country as men and preventing them from military duties is equivacable to gender inequality.<sep>Keypoint: Women are an asset in combat
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that women are just as capable at defending our country as men and preventing them from military duties is equivacable to gender inequality.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Women should have equal right to men and there for should be allowed to go into combat<sep>Keypoint: Women are an asset in combat
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that women should have equal right to men and there for should be allowed to go into combat

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Men are physically superior to women. we should only have the strongest people in combat<sep>Keypoint: Men are better suited to combat roles than women
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that men are physically superior to women. we should only have the strongest people in combat

Argument: Women do not have the physical abilities that men do, which are necessary in life or death combat situations<sep>Keypoint: Men are better suited to combat roles than women

Argument: We should prohibit women in combat because they aren't physically capable, females are proven to be weaker than males.<sep>Keypoint: Women in combat can be a distraction or harm the function of the military

Argument: Women in combat are a distraction, as a man's natural instinct is to protect a female. the male soldiers wouldn't be able to effectively do their jobs.<sep>Keypoint: Women in combat can be a distraction or harm the function of the military
Argument: Women do not have the skills or dispositions necessary to be assets in combat situations.<sep>Keypoint: Men are better suited to combat roles than women
Argument: Women should be equally allowed to serve in combat just as men can since they add unique interpersonal skills to the military unit.<sep>Keypoint: Women are an asset in combat
Argument: Women are more emotionally sensitive and may have more emotional problems after returning from combat.<sep>Keypoint: Women cannot overcome physical/emotional/mental barriers

Argument: We shouldn't stop woman going into combat because everyone is equal and if a woman thinks she can fight then she should be allowed to do so..<sep>Keypoint: There should be equality between men and women.
